exercise.task: Iran breaks nuclear deal Iran has broken the terms of the nuclear deal for the first time since it was signed in 2015 in a move that will put pressure on Europe to do more to help mitigate the effect of crippling US sanctions . The brea[fillIn groesse="5" parser="none"] of t[fillIn groesse="5" parser="none"] limits o[fillIn groesse="5" parser="none"] uranium stock[fillIn groesse="5" parser="none"] , warned o[fillIn groesse="5" parser="none"] in adv[fillIn groesse="5" parser="none"] by Iran , fol[fillIn groesse="5" parser="none"] the US withd[fillIn groesse="5" parser="none"] from t[fillIn groesse="5" parser="none"] deal last year a[fillIn groesse="5" parser="none"] frustration i[fillIn groesse="5" parser="none"] Tehran that EU sta[fillIn groesse="5" parser="none"] have be[fillIn groesse="5" parser="none"] unable t[fillIn groesse="5" parser="none"] do mo[fillIn groesse="5" parser="none"] to counter[fillIn groesse="5" parser="none"] the res[fillIn groesse="5" parser="none"] of US sanc[fillIn groesse="5" parser="none"] . European lea[fillIn groesse="5" parser="none"] urged Iran n[fillIn groesse="5" parser="none"] to breach the deal , including at a meeting on Friday . They will watch to see whether Tehran makes further breaches of the deal on 7 July , as it has threatened .
